Dear Anne, sorry that our restaurant has not fulfilled expectations. Unfortunately we remember your visit, but as we take very seriously all comments, we have analyzed and we feel obliged to make some qualification. All pizzas have the same masses and the same amount, they are all thin crust, ie, the 4 cheese hardly could be very edge or more than others. There are many photos on display by other customers and it is clear that our pizzas are between 1 and 1.5 cm. The ingredients of the pizza 4 cheese (organic tomato, French Emmental, 100x100 goat, ecological Brie and a real Roquefort quality and ecological oregano) should not make it rather bland, but quite the opposite, as they are 4 cheese with personality. For coffee, we have a Swiss coffee brand Jura (in view of diners), that coffee lovers know, which grinds coffee when serving, and throws it automatically, that is, there is never well . The coffee used, we used a large country house, which is the product of 4 grains from different countries, 70% arabica and 30% robusta. Finally, the decor of the room, is a topic of discussion difficult, as it involves subjective personal tastes. We hope that these clarifications will be constructive and invite you to give us another chance, try another pizza or other dish, as well as all the desserts are home preparation. Do not hesitate to tell us any problem at the same time, we will try to resolve it without doubt. Thank you so much

The good: Great deal, great staff and great drinks (350 ml bottle of Coke and 1.5 liters of water) The bad: Pizzas FATAL. We are a love of the pizza, we like each and of all types, Italian and American, fine, normal or bread dough, so we were excited to try one of the best pizzerias in Andorra, if not the best, based to criticism. We ordered a galette (savory pancake) and three pizzas, one author, one four cheeses and a margarita. The three pizzas served us extremely hard, you almost could not split them with a knife !!!, salty and not good taste, use cheese (emmenthal?) Instead of mozzarella, tomato is also tasty. We do not understand how you can have so many positive reviews. We have hesitated to write it or not, so attentive and good service, but we could have seen a review like this, to not choose this place for dinner.

Dear Customer, Thank you for your opinion. We are pleased that at least the treatment and service have been to his liking and that hath not upset crepe. But we are surprised and disappointed us much their assessment of the pizzas. We seriously thought of his criticism to understand your vision, and to improve or change what is within our reach. We can say in terms of mass is a mass that do more than 30 years ago, the same recipe, carries very little yeast, this makes very little light, obtaining a thin crust. It is not soft but it should not be hard. On the other hand, also over 30 years we opted to use emmental french ago, first because it is mozzarella certified buffalo offerings cow mozzarella currently on the market are in their substitutes most cheese, with large proportions whey, binders, thickeners, additives, aromas and colorants. Our policy is to use natural products as possible, and if they are Bio better. Therefore we opted for a cheese with denomination of origin, we consider soft going very well for our type of pizza. The second reason has to do with the Italian immigration. When Italians have been coming to different parts of the world have adapted pizza to the site of settlement. And in France, the Italians arrive in Marseille, and begins to make pizza with emmental cheese. As my training is French, I have always used this for my cheese pizzas. Finally, we have said several times, the tomato used is natural, ecological and Italian, which just add a pinch of salt and pepper. Probably not come back here, which is understandable, but we advise that in a similar situation, and given that the treatment has been friendly, its time she spoke at the time, and the establishment, you can better understand your appreciation and have the possibility of changing something in that moment. Thank you so much

Thank you for your review Mr. Simone. We respond to your comment can tell you that currently the two most used internationally masses are: The deep dish, high yeast and very thin crust, with less yeast. The latter is chosen by us, we left to ferment for at least 14 hours. If sometimes missing ingredients, regardless of the day, it is because we work as much as possible with fresh products, we do everything ourselves and the limited space prevents us from having a great stock. Always we deliver the letter to our customers to choose their dishes, and at no time is it written that we use cow mozzarella sticks, which we believe is referred to. The vast majority of our pizzas take as a basis the French Emmentaler cheese and mozzarella we use only in some of our pizzas author, it is the buffalo milk. And in any case we use pre-made, industrial and much less topping sauces, even we are totally against its use. Simply we regret that the pizza was not what I expected. Sincerely LEscenari of Pizzes

Conveniently located near the center of Andorra la Vella local offers a good selection of meats and especially foundees and recletttes. The restaurant has two spacious rooms decorated with taste (in the ground floor and first floor) that allow quiet dinner without being assaulted by converasciones or smells of the nearby tables. As for the food it is worth noting the reclettes and foundees that are the stars of the premises and offered in a variety of cheeses and accompaniments. Although it is a bit heavy menu (especially for dinner) the quality of the raw material makes it not a greasy experience (as it does in other places). It is therefore a good opportunity to taste a food that otherwise is not very common in the cuisine of the Peninsula. Although not disproportionately expensive it certainly is not no bargain and not noted for an outstanding price / quality ratio. In short offer good food and a good service but they are charging.

In one of the many occasions when we traveled to Andorra, we decided to look online to see if we could find a restaurant to eat. When discovered El Refugi Alpi raclette and those that had looked so good, we went there. When we arrived, and decided to ask for a raclette, we were weighing the different varieties, so we decided on a real Raclette, which is composed of the famous raclette, an assortment of cold cuts (high quality) and a bowl of potato cooked with skin (cachelos style). The presentation of the raclette accompaniments and was most curious and immediately invited a bite. The treatment was successful and staff at all times were watching us. The taste of raclette, excellent! To say that we also ordered seconds as the raclette was four, but after this experience, I would say that with the raclette is more than enough. Second, we ask: Ravioli fresh pasta stuffed with shrimp and scallops (tasty), Feet of grilled pork (which according commented were very good and plentiful), and costilletas of grilled lamb (which also had very good review ). For dessert, and if all this were not enough, we dared with a chocolate fondue was outstanding.

The desserts, the homemade mostly rich too. The problem came time to pay. We went with young children, it was getting late and they were falling asleep. We asked the waiters account. 5 minutes, 10 minutes ... I went back to ask for the bill, explaining the reason for the rush: accounts makes the boss ... In the end, after 40 minutes by the clock, and, having claimed 3-4 Sometimes it appeared the boss with the account. No apology. And the icing, to review it I see that there was an error of 10 € in the price of wine (of course, in favor). Again, another 10-15 minutes of waiting and, again, no apology nor any details. In short, it took longer to pay than dinner. No doubt its a single event, but we much we tarnished the image of the restaurant and I doubt repeat.

In addition, you do not pay the usual price: € 181 for two (2 glasses of champagne, 2 tasting menus with agreement puts / wine (4 glasses), coffee / tea and a bottle of water), about 50% which would be paid for a similar meal in starred restaurants usually present in France. All in a great atmosphere with a very nice service. Truly a beautiful place not to be missed!

Andorran cream dessert (highly recommended) and bread with chocolate (oages toasted bread rubbed with hot black chocolate with oil and salt flakes poc to avoid heartburn. Two glasses of wine and water. € 40 total, more than acceptable. In my case it has become a fixture in visits to Andorra.
